content: I set up detailed tracing for my custom codegen, but is there any way to get it to work with RUSTC_LOG or do i need to set up my own env? trying to use rustc_log does not seem to work :/
hmm or maybe the issue is rustc uses info as the max level, while i use debug and trace for my stuff

So for debug and trace logging to work you need to set

[rust]
debug = true

in config.toml. RUSTC_LOG was also broken for a few days recently, so check that you have #89743.
debug = trueenables debug assertions as well, if you only want tracing then you can set debug-logging = true instead

hmm yeah i think that is the issue, im using nightly and not my custom built rustc (which is the same as nightly currently). I thought it would just work because my codegen (built as dylib) does have debug and trace enabled and not compiled out
@Riccardo D'Ambrosio if you build the dylib with debug logging, that only affects your own backend, not rustc proper
